intro: Frankenia palmeri, commonly known as the Palmer's frankenia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, clustered flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Frankenia palmeri is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
